comparisons.answer1: If XCl2, then X should be a metal with valency 2 Therefore - (1) Sulphate formula: XSO4 - (2) Hydroxide formula: X(OH)2
comparisons.answer2: If XCl ₂ is the chloride, then metal X has valency 2. Therefore: - ● Sulphate formula: XSO ₄ - ● Hydroxide formula: X(OH) ₂

comparisons.answer1: XN is nitride X is a valency 3 metal as nitrogen has valency 3 Therefore Sulphate's formula would be X2(SO4)3 and Hydroxide formula would be X(OH)3
comparisons.answer2: If XN is the nitride, metal X has valency 3 (since nitrogen has valency 3). Therefore: i) Sulphate formula: X ₂ (SO ₄ ) ₃ ii) Hydroxide formula: X(OH) ₃ - i)

comparisons.answer1: valency of nitrogen in: 1) NO : +2 2) N2O : +1 3) NO2 : +4
comparisons.answer2: Valency of nitrogen in: i) NO: +2 ii) N ₂ O: +1 iii) NO ₂ : +4 Additional Questions

comparisons.answer1: The eight metals showing variable valency 1) Iron (Fe) : +2, +3, ...=> (2) copper (Cu) : +1, +2 (3) Mercury (Hg) : +1, +2 (4) Tin (Sn) : +2, +4 (5) *Le (Pb) : +2, +4 (6) Gold (Au) : +1, +3 (7) Chromium (Cr) : +2, +3, +6 (8) Manganese (Mn) : +2, +3, +4, +6, +7
comparisons.answer2: Eight metals showing variable valency: - 1. Iron (Fe): +2, +3 - 2. Copper (Cu): +1, +2 - 3. Mercury (Hg): +1, +2 - 4. Tin (Sn): +2, +4 - 5. Lead (Pb): +2, +4 - 6. Gold (Au): +1, +3 - 7. Chromium (Cr): +2, +3, +6 - 8. Manganese (Mn): +2, +3, +4, +6, +7 Valency of sulphur in: a) SO ₂ : +4 b) SO ₃ : +6

comparisons.answer1: Examples of Chemical Equations: *stat aligned with intended n Justifications are provided below. ## Page 2 (a) One product : 2H2 + O2 -> 2H2O (b) Two Products : CaCO3 -> CaO + CO2 + - (b) Two Products : CaCO3 -> CaO + CO2 + (C) Three Products : 4HN03 -> 2H2O + 4NO2 + O2 (d) four Products : 2KLO3 -> 2K4 + 2O2 + O2 - (d) four Products : 2KLO3 -> 2K4 + 2O2 + O2
comparisons.answer2: Examples of chemical equations: a) One product: 2H ₂ + O ₂ → 2H ₂ O b) Two products: CaCO ₃ → CaO + CO ₂ c) Three products: 4HNO ₃ → 2H ₂ O + 4NO ₂ + O ₂ d) Four products: 2KClO ₃ → 2KCl + 2O ₂ + O ₂ + Heat
